sources.title: Dr. Cyclops
sources.description: A mad scientist working in the South American jungle miniaturizes his colleagues when he feels his megalomania is threatened.

sources.title: Dr. Cyclops (1940)
sources.description: "Dr. Cyclops" is a 1940 American science fiction horror film directed by Ernest B. Schoedsack, known for being the first horror film made in full three-strip Technicolor. It follows the story of Dr. Alexander Thorkel, a mad scientist who shrinks his colleagues to microscopic size in his jungle laboratory. When they threaten to expose his experiments, he uses his invention to miniaturize them. The scientists must navigate the dangers of the jungle while trying to escape Thorkel's clutches.

metadata.Plot: Four explorers are summoned to Peru by the brilliant physicist Dr Thorkel. They discover a rich source of radium and a half-mad Thorkel who shrinks them down to one-fifth their normal size when they threaten to stop his unorthodox experimentation.
metadata.Actors: Albert Dekker, Thomas Coley, Janice Logan
